alert.note: Alert for South Central Lowlands And Southern Rio Grande Valley; Southwest Deserts and Lowlands; Southwest Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 30 at 7:38AM MDT until May 31 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHWEST NEW MEXICO.. .A warm dry airmass continue to sit across the southwest U.S. On Wednesday an approaching upper level storm system will increase afternoon winds. Min RH`s near 10% and southwest winds near 20 mph, we will see low end Red Flag conditions Wednesday afternoon and early evening for parts of southwest New Mexico and the Gila Region. Conditions will improve after sunset when temperatures decrease and winds become light and terrain-driven. Our warm dry weather will continue through the end of the week. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM MDT WEDNESDAY FOR WARM, DRY, AND WINDY CONDITIONS... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zones 110, 111 and 112. This includes Grant, Hidalgo, Luna, Dona Ana, Sierra, and portions of Otero and Catron Counties in southwest New Mexico. * WIND...Southwest at 15 to 20 mph with gusts 25 to 30 mph. * HUMIDITY...8 to 14 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: South Central Lowlands And Southern Rio Grande Valley; Southwest Deserts and Lowlands; Southwest Mountains
